Sure, here's the updated table with the additional column:

| Framework | Regulatory Body | Focus | Applicability | Required Format | Sources |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| GRI Standards | Global Reporting Initiative | Sustainability | Voluntary | None, but recommends use of GRI Standards for comprehensive reporting | [source](https://www.globalreporting.org/standards/what-are-the-gri-standards/) |
| SASB Standards | Sustainability Accounting Standards Board | Sustainability | Voluntary | None, but recommends use of SASB Standards for industry-specific reporting | [source](https://www.sasb.org/standards/) |
| TCFD Recommendations | Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures | Climate-related risks and opportunities | Voluntary, but increasingly being adopted by governments and investors | None, but recommends disclosure in mainstream financial filings | [source](https://www.fsb-tcfd.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/FINAL-2017-TCFD-Report-11052018.pdf) |
| IR Framework | International Integrated Reporting Council | Integrated Reporting | Voluntary | None, but recommends use of integrated reporting framework for comprehensive reporting | [source](https://integratedreporting.org/resource/international-ir-framework/) |
| EU Taxonomy Regulation | European Union | Climate-related risks and opportunities | Mandatory for companies subject to NFRD and SFDR | Not applicable, but reporting must be aligned with EU Taxonomy and use common classification system | [source](https://ec.europa.eu/info/business-economy-euro/banking-and-finance/sustainable-finance/eu-taxonomy-sustainable-activities_en) |
| SFDR | European Union | Sustainability of financial products | Mandatory for financial market participants and financial advisers | Not applicable, but requires disclosure of certain information in pre-contractual documents and periodic reports | [source](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX%3A32019R2088) |
| CSRD | European Union | Sustainability reporting | Proposed to be mandatory for all large companies operating in the EU | Companies to use the European Single Electronic Format (ESEF) for sustainability information in annual reports, based on Inline XBRL (iXBRL) | [source](https://ec.europa.eu/info/business-economy-euro/company-reporting-and-auditing/company-reporting/non-financial-reporting_en) |
